title: Adesto Technologies Adds Chief Technology Officer to Leadership Team
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/28/2015 @ 1:00 PM   Adesto Technologies 
SUNNYVALE, CA -- (Marketwired) -- 09/28/15 -- Adesto Technologies, a leading provider of application-specific, feature-rich, ultra-low power non-volatile memory products, today announced that it has added Gideon Intrater as its Chief Technology Officer. 
Mr. Intrater brings more than 30 years of experience in the semiconductor industry to his role in the company. 
"Gideon is a creative technologist with broad experience creating silicon solutions that bring benefits at the system level," said Narbeh Derhacobian, CEO and Co-Founder of Adesto. "His deep understanding of system architectures and how memory solutions should be designed and integrated holistically with processors, microcontrollers, and system-on-chip components makes him a strong asset to Adesto. Gideon will be a valuable member of our management as we march forward in our mission of delivering applications specific memory solutions to our customers." 
Mr. Intrater serves on the advisory board of Centipede Semi and Think Silicon and was previously a member of the advisory board of Sansa Security (acquired by ARM in July 2015). Previously, Mr. Intrater was Vice President of Marketing at MIPS Technologies (until the company was sold in February 2013). Before joining MIPS, from October 2008 to December 2010, Mr. Intrater was Vice President of Architecture for Symwave, a privately-held supplier of high-performance analog/mixed signal semiconductor solutions for consumer devices. Prior to Symwave, Mr. Intrater held various management positions at MIPS Technologies and National Semiconductor Corporation. Mr. Intrater holds over 30 issued patents. He earned BSEE and MSEE degrees from the Technion, Israel Institute of Technology, and an MBA from San Jose State University. 
About Adesto Technologies Corporation Adesto is a leading provider of application-specific, feature-rich, ultra-low power non-volatile memory products. The company has designed and built a portfolio of innovative products, including Fusion Serial Flash, DataFlash® and Conductive Bridging RAM (CBRAM®). CBRAM® is a breakthrough technology platform that enables 100 times less energy consumption than today's memory technologies without sacrificing speed and performance. Founded in 2007 in Sunnyvale, CA, Adesto holds more than 100 patents with dozens more in process and is working with visionary companies across various industries to deploy its technology to the market.
